intro: Poa attenuata subsp. argunensis, commonly known as the Argun grass, is a perennial grass species native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It is characterized by its slender, grass-like leaves and produces small, spike-like inflorescences. The plant typically grows in well-drained soils and is adapted to cold, alpine environments. It is often found in meadows and rocky slopes at high elevations. Due to its ecological significance, it plays a role in stabilizing soil and supporting local biodiversity.
